Game.Name: Rescue Mission (USA, Europe)
Game.plot: Overview:The goal of Rescue Mission is to provide covering fire as a medic uses a hand-cart to reach different wounded soldiers and stitch up their injuries. The medic is assaulted on all sides from enemy troops, which the player must shoot down before the medic is killed. Though the medic has three lives, in actuality there are three different medics - when one dies, he is gone for good and the next one replaces him. The player must also be careful to not shoot the injured soldiers themselves, though once healed these soldiers leave behind useful healing items.Unlike most Sega games, Rescue Mission was never released in Japan. Light gun games fared a lot better outside the Sega Master System's home nation.
Game.Notes: It's war... and your buddies are trapped behind enemy lines! Before they can escape, they urgently need medical attention... and desperately need your help! You're an Army sharpshooter. You have the Sega Light Phaser and lightning-fast reflexes. Now, you are going on a hero's mission to save your friends. With only a railroad handcart for transportation, you're taking three combat medics deep into enemy territory. They'll take care of your friends. Your job: shoot down everything the enemy throws at them... and you!
